page.title: 16History in our Block.
page.content: Our block is steeped in history from very early times through to the early twentieth century. The earliest remains take the form of a large hill which once formed the home of an Iron Age tribe. They lived on the top of the hill and it was surrounded by earthworks and wooden defences. From the top one has a clear view of the surrounding area. The hill is now known as the Uley Bury. Eventually a tribe of Britons called the Dubunni took over the hill fort until they themselves were conquered by the Romans. Near Uley Bury lies the Uley Tumulus,an ancient burial mound. Parts of this are open to the public. The main Roman remains were discovered in the fairly recent past. There were parts of a ruined Roman Temple. Unfortunately the remains had to be filled in,due to lack of finance and
